body.name: Willhom 821-1500-A Hard Drive Cable Upgrade Kit SSD Replacement for Mac Mini A1347 2010 2011 2012
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 8 hrs 1 min
features: This is the lower hard drive cable 821-1500-a for the A1347 Mac Mini Server Mid 2010-Late 2012.In the 2011 or 2012 models, this cable is used to add a 2nd internal hard drive. In the 2010 models, this is the standard hard drive cable.
Replace a malfunctioning or torn SATA hard drive cable for a Mac mini A1347 (Mid 2010-Late 2012).Or add a second hard drive or solid state drive to your Mac mini with this awesome kit
Your Mac mini supports two hard drives—get the cable and hardware you need to make the upgrade. No need to pay the Apple premium for an expensive Mac mini server when you can do it yourself and save.
Upgrading your Mac mini couldn't be simpler.You provide the drive, we include everything you need for a successful DIY repair.

What's included: Secondary hard drive cable kit (821-1500-A hard drive flex cable, nylon spudger, U-shaped logic board removal tool, 2 - L-shaped crowbars with torx and phillips heads, 4 - rubber mounting grommets, and 4 - screws)

Compatible with Mac mini A1347 Mid 2010 to Late 2012: -Macmini4,1 Mid 2010: MC270LL/A orMC438LL/A, -Macmini5,1 Mid 2011: MC815LL/A,MC816LL/A or MC936LL/A,-Macmini6,1 Late 2012: MD387LL/A,MD388LL/A or MD389LL/A

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Lower Hard Drive Flex Cable for Mac mini A1347 (Mid 2010-Late 2012) Replace a malfunctioning or torn SATA hard drive cable for a Mac mini. This is the bottom hard drive cable for the A1347 Mac Mini Server. It's using for add the second HDD if your standby HDD located in upper bay. (You can check in Mac System.) Some 2012 Mac minis shipped with the hard drive in the upper bay instead of the lower bay. To find this information, open Applications->Utilities->System Information and click SATA/SATA Express on the left. Under "Bay Name" it will list either "Lower" or "Upper." Secondary Lower Hard Drive Flex Cable Kit What's included 1 * Lower hard drive flex cable 1 * nylon spudger1 * U-shaped logic board removal tool2 * L-shaped crowbars with torx and phillips heads4 * rubber mounting grommets 4 * screwsOur hard drive flex cable kits are individually tested and guaranteed to function perfectly. Identifying Numbers APN: 076-1412, 922-9560PPN: 821-1500-A

COMPATIBILITY: Compatible with Mac mini Late 2012 A1347 (EMC 2570) Macmini6,1 Late 2012: MD387LL/A (2.5 GHz Core i5)Macmini6,2 Late 2012: MD388LL/A (2.3 GHz Core i7) or (2.6 GHz Core i7)Macmini6,3 Late 2012 (Server): MD389LL/A (2.3 GHz Core i7) or (2.6 GHz Core i7) Compatible with Mac mini Mid 2011 A1347 (EMC 2442) Macmini5,1 Mid 2011: MC815LL/A (2.3 GHz Core i5)Macmini5,2 Mid 2011: MC816LL/A (2.5 GHz Core i5) or (2.7 GHz Core i7)Macmini5,3 Mid 2011 (Server): MC936LL/A (2.0 GHz Core i7) Compatible with Mac mini Mid 2010 A1347 (EMC 2364) Macmini4,1 Mid 2010: MC270LL/A (2.4 GHz Core 2 Duo) or (2.66 GHz Core 2 Duo)Macmini4,2 Mid 2010 (Server): MC438LL/A (2.66 GHz Core 2 Duo) Please double check the compatibility list to determine the compatibility and check the pictures and description carefully before bidding. Extremely Important: Please install it very professionally, if not,don't try. You will receive a 100% compatible secondary hard drive cable kit.The exact brand,part number and package of the secondary hard drive cable kit you will receive is determined by market availability.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Repair tough but successful.
reviews.reviewText: After working on PC’s for 20+ years I got my first Mac and I broke the flex cable on the SATA drive. Macs are a lot different than PC’s. Cable was a little hard to install but it’s a Mac mini. Upgrades are a little tough due to the compactness of the computer but overall the cable works as expected. A+. Thank you. You saved my Mac.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as good as original
reviews.reviewText: My Mac Mini wouldn’t power up, and through the process of elimination, I discovered what was wrong. My computer wouldn’t power on with the hard drive attached. When I unplugged the sata connector, the computer would power on and attempt to boot. I was hoping it was as the sata connector failing and not my SSD. I purchased this sata connector, connected it to my SSD, and voila! My computer powered up like normal. Overall, I’m satisfied with this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This is the incorrect cable for 2012 Mac mini installation for additional hdd/ssd
reviews.reviewText: I'll keep this simple; thought I was losing it. Actually; I did lose it. this thing has been sitting dormant with frequent retries every few days or so. Its the wrong cable. It tried to sit in the same SATA space as the original cable which won't work. Otherwise I'm sure the kit is great, but the product description being incorrect is why I'm leaving the 1 star review. Will look for another kit before I break this dang thing. Happy tinkering!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what we needed!
reviews.reviewText: My friend had a 2012 Mac Mini with a single 500GB spinner in it, we wanted to put a 1TB SSD in it. Plan was to replace the HDD, but when we opened up his machine, it turned out to be in the "upper" bay, aka the one that's quite difficult to access. After ordering this kit, we were able to put the SSD in the "lower" bay (the one accessible without removing the motherboard) giving him both drives operable!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Used to replace a missing HDD cable in a 2011 Mac Mini, worked perfectly fit perfectly just like OEM

reviews.reviewText: Motherboard tool does the job for MacMiniThe torx are not security torx however (with the hollow in the middle) so this kit is not the complete solution for MacMini HD replace

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed
reviews.reviewText: Just what I needed for my 2011 mac mini

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars In a 2012 Mini, this is NOT for second drive, wrong cable; NO INSTRUCTIONS. Buy iFixIt instead.
reviews.reviewText: Before making this purchase, please the negative reviews by searching for your YEAR Mac to see what people report.Seller claims: "In the 2011 or 2012 models, this cable is used to add a 2nd internal hard drive." NOPEWell, the cable I received is 100% IDENTICAL TO THE PRIMARY drive cable I already had inside my 2012. I see this problem happened to other 2012 reviewers. You can't perform a 2 drive install using two primary cables - one won't reach because both cables are intended to be unequal lengths.I think their supplier is mixing up the cables when making a kit, or their 2012 model notes are wrong, or maybe there's some variation on Apple's part. The problem is not "skill" the seller says you need (I can hand solder 0402 and have reassembled iphones).Just pay more for the ifixit kit, but you'll get back free time, and they have a great community and deserve the support. If you order the Willhom 821-1500-A anyways, install it right away don't sit on it until return window closes.Aside from the kit being wrong cable, all the necessary parts look decent. Kit has the torx you need, logic bar puller, grommets, and the PCB cable looks to be same quality as the original.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ce câble est destiné au disque dur principal.

reviews.reviewText: Not for 2nd (lower) drive. Did not fit. This was not an expansion "upgrade" drive cable. This was the same size as the regular (top) drive slot, so it was a duplicate to the drive cable that was already installed. Had to buy from another supplier and when I compared the cable lengths, the other one was longer and fit as the 2nd (lower) drive connector. Was then able to "upgrade" to having 2 hard drives.

reviews.reviewTitle: IT'S NOT FOR A SECOND DRIVE
reviews.reviewText: This is not an upgrade for a second drive, it's just a replacement for the Main drive. Don't buy it if you want to install a second drive because it doesn't fit.
It is not for the 2nd hard drive.all the kit is for the second hdd however the cable is the wrong one.
